required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of a COVID-19 Pneumonia CXR AI Detection Algorithm
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of a Chest X-Ray AI Neural Network (RadGen SARS-CoV2 Detection System) for the Detection of RT-PCR Confirmed SARS-Cov2 Covid-19 Pneumonia

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigates the diagnostic performance of an AI algorithm in the detection of COVID-19 pneumonia on chest radiographs.

detailed_description.textblock: This is an international multi-center study. Chest radiographs (CXR) from different participating centers will be collected to develop an AI algorithm to detect COVID-19 pneumonia. This will be tested on external hold out datasets from different centers using SARS-CoV-2 by Real-Time Reverse Transcriptase-Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR) Assay as ground truth.

primary_outcome.description: Performance (accuracy, sensitivity, specificity, false-positive rate (FPR), false-negative rate (FNR), and Area Under the Curve (AUC)) of the AI model in detection of COVID-19 pneumonia on their baseline CXR using RT-PCR and historical controls as gold standard in a multi-center / multi-national cohort.

arm_group.description: RT-PCR confirmed patients positive for SARS-CoV-2
RT-PCR confirmed patients negative for SARS-CoV-2 or patients with CXR performed before the emergence of COVID-19 pandemic

study_pop.textblock:
There will be three subsets of study population in this study; patients who were
1. RT-PCR confirmed COVID-19 positive
2. RT-PCR confirmed COVID-19 negative
3. either had a diagnosis of pneumonia before the 1st January 2020.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All adult patients >18 years of age
- Attended any of the participating institutes between February 1, 2020 until September, 2020
- Underwent both RT-PCR testing and frontal CXR (within 48 hours of PCR testing) for COVID-19 infection
- frontal CXR of patients pre-covid pandemic
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unavailability of patient demographics and clinical data
- Inconclusive RT-PCR results
- CXR considered to be of non-diagnostic quality by the clinical radiology research team at each site
- CXR not in a retrievable or processable format for AI inference
